item.title:
pro tip for using Cursor: give verbose prompts!
- think aloud in detail, don't be afraid to ramble - use voice input, much faster than typing
I find this works well because the detail improves quality/control a ton, but it's still much faster than doing everything by hand

item.title:
R to @geoffreylitt: obviously talking with real people has benefits for language learning… building up genuine relationships etc.
But for efficient on-demand conversation anytime on any topic, with built in coaching, voice mode clearly has the edge.

item.title:
ChatGPT Advanced Voice Mode has been awesome for practicing my Japanese — I ask it to converse on a topic and give me ideas for more sophisticated vocab and idioms.
Works great at the advanced stage. Super curious how it would do for more beginner language learning.
